intro: Zygophlebia villosissima, commonly known as the woolly zygophlebia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are often clustered together. Zygophlebia villosissima is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
